response_parsed.title: Observing Machine Learning Training Loops with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to monitor the progress of a machine learning (ML) training loop using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Create an API endpoint for monitoring the ML training loop
Implement live updates by periodically sending status updates from within the training loop
Use FastAPI's built-in functionality to handle concurrent connections efficiently

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, WebSocket
app = FastAPI()
sticky_connection = app.websocket('/train')
@sticky_connection
def train(websocket):  # ... training loop implementation goes here ...

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required due to FastAPI's support for asynchronous and concurrent connections.
Be sure to install the necessary dependencies, such as FastAPI and Uvicorn.
caveats: Ensure your machine learning training loop can be paused periodically to send updates
Manage connections efficiently by using sticky sessions in case of long-running connections
